dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet, upper-middle class, North Shore Chicago suburb. Chevy Blazer cruises slowly down the street. Morning Papers are pitched out the window. A dog runs between the houses. It's early autumn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An attractive, old, three-story brick colonial. A news- paper flies into frame, strikes the corner of the house a drops into the bushes, a good twenty feet from the porch. An alarm clock goes off with a jarring bzzzzz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alarm continues for a beat. It stops and the house explodes with activity as the Baker family wakes and scrambles about their morning activities. There's Jim Baker, midforties, father, insurance executive, tall, lea somewhat meek-looking, in his suit pants and handlebar undershirt scurrying to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Let's go! Chop, chop! We've got relatives invading this afternoon! He slams’the bathroom door. His wife, Brenda, whips out o the bedroom in her housecoat and heads down the stairs. She's also in her midforties, strong, attractive and dominant. Mike Baker, ten, wanders out of his bedroom, . stratching his rear end, yawning. He's young trouble, preteen maniac boy.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (as she descends) Ginny! Mike! Sara! Sam!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (phoney, pained) Oh, God. I think I have a fever. Sara Baker, seven, comes out of her room. She's all sweetness and cutes.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: You don't have a fever.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Why don't you shut your face?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Make me. Mike raises a fist. Sara shrieks.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Dad! Mike hit me!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: _ You liar! The bathroom door opens and Jim comes out with a toothbru in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talks with the toothbrush in his mouth) Mike! Come on, pal, we're having a wedding tomorrow. Why can't you cooperate? Ginny Baker, twenty-one, comes out of her room in panties and a sweatshirt. She's very pretty, very pampered and very sloppy. She slips past Jim as he scolds Mike, goes into the bathroom and locks the door. Sara turns and marches into the bathroom at the other end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Dad, I didn't hit her. I'd like to very much and I probably will later, but give me a break, you know my method. I don't hit her when you're just down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Pick on somebody your own size. He turns back to the bathroom. MIKE AND SARA ‘ 3-A She gives Mike a smug, snotty face. He squints angrily.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Later. Sara turns up her nose and goes back down the hall to the other bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: 3-B
dialogues.text: discovers the bathroom door's locked. He rattles the knob

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: I was in there first! Open the door!

dialogues.speaker: GINNY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I'm so sure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny's standing in the shower with the water beating aga the side of her head.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: I'm the one getting married, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Not until tomorrow. Come on! I got a mouthful of toothpaste!

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: (to herself) What a pest. (to Jim) I happen to have a serious problem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim growls angrily and gives up. He turns to see Mike leaning on the knewl post, eavesdropping.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (with a chuckle) ‘She has her period, Dad. (raises an eyebrow) Should make for an interesting honeymoon, huh? Jim looks at Mike, startled by the brash maturity of his remark. Mike trots down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Where're you getting that mouth?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (matter-of- factly) School.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda's making coffee, eggs, toast and school lunches al at the same time. Mike wanders in and turns on the TV and dials in cartoons. A bowl of cereal is waiting for him. He starts to eat. :

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Is everybody up?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yep. Jim walks in and crosses to the sink.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Nope. He spits in the sink. Brenda stares at him. She leans over and looks in the sink.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Thank you, dear. You just unloaded all over my luncheon.

dialogues.speaker: SINK
dialogues.text: A bowl of boiled shrimp covered with toothpaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim smiles sheepishly at Brenda. She turns on the water to rinse the shrimp.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Mike, make sure Sam gets up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (shouts) Sara! Wake up Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara's standing on a stool, bare-chested with an underarm lathered with shave cream. She's shaving her underarms with Jim's electric razor. ‘She turns it off, put-out wit the order to wake Sam. :

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! What am I? A slave? She opens the door.  10 11 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara comes out of the bathroom, crosses to a door leading to a third floor staircase and yells.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Hey, Dorklips! Haul ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a girl's bedroom done in antiques and frills. In contrast to the mayhem on the first two floors, the third floor is quiet and serene. A brilliant shaft of morning sunlight shines down through a skylight above the brass bed. The sheets and blankets are rumpled and kicked aside Samantha Baker stands before a floor mirror in the corner of the room. Her back is to camera. A bath towel is wrapped around her waist. She's staring at her body in th mirror. She was up long before anyone else in the house _ and has already showered. She puts a hand on her hip an strikes a pose. She doesn't like it. She tries the other hand. Both hands. She cocks her hip. Finally, she raises both arms and strikes a Charles Atlas pose. She holds it for a moment, then drops her arms. She groans.

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA'S FACE 12
dialogues.text: She's young and pretty. No seething, precocious sexuality Just a pretty, young girl. She's frowning. Obviously dis- pleased with her looks.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Chronologically, you're sixteen today. Physically, you're still fifteen. She lifts her damp hair off her face and neck and examine the effect. She's not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (drops the hair) Worthless. She reaches down, out of frame, and comes up with a telephone. .

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (to the phone) I look exactly the same as I have since summer. Utterly forgettable.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 12
dialogues.text: She walks to a window seat and sits down. She pulls her knees up under her chin.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (pause, still looking in the mirror) No, I didn't expect to wake up trans- formed. I just thought that turning sixteen is so major I'd wake up with an improved mental state that would show on my face. All that shows is the fact that I don't have any tan left. (with a closing sigh) My family's probably pissed that I haven't come down to let them wish me ‘Happy Birthday'. I'll see you at school. She hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I need four inches of bod and a great birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam comes down the hall, buttoning her blouse. Jim comes out of the bedroom, dressed for work. She sees him and stops. She smiles, waiting for a “happy birthday" from hi

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (bright, cheerful) Hi, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Hi, Sam. Better hurry. And that's it. No happy birthday. Sam is stunned. She watches him hurry down the stairs. The bathroom door open and Ginny comes out swaddled in bath towels. She sees Sam and sighs dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: You know what today is?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 13
dialogues.text: Sam smiles and nods, expecting a birthday greeting from Ginny.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: The first day of my all-new com- pletely screwed-up period. Are you on the pill? Sam's smile fades. She shakes her head slowly.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Then you'll probably have a great honeymoon. (to herself) This is such a deluxe bite. Ginny goes back into the bathroom and locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (to herself, sarcastically) Thank you. Yes, it is my birthday. How nice of you to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda herds Mike and Sara through the dining room and in the foyer. Jim comes in from the living room. He's fran- tically searching for his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Where's my briefcase? He opens the closet and rummages around for the briefcase

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Where'd you leave it?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Don't be a smart ass!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll be a dumb ass.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: You already are.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (to Sara) Touche!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 14
dialogues.text: BRENDA (Cont'd) (to Jim) Where's Sam?

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Where's my briefcase? He pulls out hockey sticks, coats, hats, boots, toys, but no briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (yells up the stairs) Sam!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (to Brenda) Allow me, Brenda. (yells) Hey! Birth defect! Sam comes down the stairs, dressed, with her books under her arm. She scowls at Mike and smiles at Brenda. Again, she's expecting a birthday greeting.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (to Sam) You missed breakfast again.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: It wasn't my idea to give her her own phone line. I don't have my own phone line.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (to Sam) Grab a doughnut.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: I wouldn't if I were you. Mike tongued all the powdered sugar off. They're totally infected. Jim kisses Brenda.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (to Jim) The grandparents'1ll be here this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: We're still going out tonight with the Rice Chex?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (corrects him) Rizezechs. Eight, at the club. And you'd better learn their names. As of tomorrow, they're family. Jim crosses to the door.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Lovely thought. (to Sam) When it comes time for you to get married, do us a favor, elope. Jim exits.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Who'd marry her?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Mr. T.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (kisses Sam's cheek) You'll have to buy lunch today. I didn't have time to do your carrots.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (laughs) She's eating carrots to increase the size of her breasts. Sam raises her fist. Brenda beats her to him and gives hi a solid shake.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: You shape up, mister, or I swear to God you won't go to your sister's wedding!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Promise? Brenda draws back to hit him. He races out the door. Brenda kisses Sara and scoots her on her way. Sam stares at Brenda, giving her one last chance to mention her birthday.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Don't give me that pouty look of yours. You can eat your carrots when you get home.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: That's it? You don't have anything else to say to me, today?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (weary) What would you like me to say, Sam? Come on, you'll miss the bus. Sam sighs and looks away.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Have a good day. Brenda exits. Sam stands alone in the foyer. She looks up at the ceiling, fighting off her tears.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (to herself, incredulous) I can't believe this. They fucking forgot my birthday. Theme music comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling suburban high school. Roll credits over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A -- Bus doors opening, young faces spilling out. B -- Every imaginable form of footwear scurrying past cam C -- Nervous fingers twirling a padlock combination and yanking on the stubborn lock. It doesn't open. D -- A pair of rumps, male and female. A male hand on the female rear, a female hand on the male. E -- The tops of a lot of boys' heads shrouded in cigaret smoke. F -- A girl's head from the brow up as she furiously fuss with her tresses. G -- Lips are painted animal pink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large study hall. A male teacher is at the head of the class grading papers. Sam's in the second seat from the back. Randy's directly behind her, slumped down in her chair with an open book propped up in front of her. She yawns. Sam's hunched over taking the sex test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One seat behind Sam in the next row of desks is a tall, handsome senior, Jake Ryan. He's an athlete and a class officer. The most significant male in the entire student body. He's bored with the study hall and is staring at Sam. She's figuring somewhere in his daydream.

dialogues.speaker: TEST
dialogues.text: Sam turns the test sheet over and continues.

dialogues.speaker: HAVE YOU EVER DONE IT
dialogues.text: Her answer, "I DON'T THINK SO".

dialogues.speaker: IF YOU ANSWERED "I DON'T THINK
dialogues.text: so" WOULD YOU EVER IF YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam thinks. It's a tough decision. She answers.

dialogues.speaker: TEST
dialogues.text: "I GUESS so"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's worried and nervous about answering the final ques- tion. She lowers her head and peeks under her arm at Jake 19 20 21 22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gnawing his thumbnail, still staring at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: HIS POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: She blanches as Jake catches her looking at him. She clum tries to make it appear as if she's just scratching her c on her shoulder. She eurns back to her test.

dialogues.speaker: TEST 26
dialogues.text: Her hand's trembling as she slowly writes "JAKE RYAN" on question #9. Her hand glides down to the last question

dialogues.speaker: KNOW THAT YOU WANT TO WITH HIM
dialogues.text: Sam writes a very definite, "NO!" and underlines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She carefully folds the test into a tiny square, palms it and pretending to yawn, puts her arms behind her head and drops the folded note on Randy's desk.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY 28
dialogues.text: She's sound asleep in her seat, head back, mouth open. Sh doesn't see the note drop on her desk. Jake does.

dialogues.speaker: DESK 29
dialogues.text: The note slides down the sloped writing desk and off.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR 30
dialogues.text: The note falls on the floor. Jake's hightop comes down on top of the note and slides it away.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE 31
dialogues.text: He reaches down and retrieves the note. He holds it in hi palm and slips it in his pocket, keeping his eyes on Sam all the while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Randy are walking down the hall. Sam's upset.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You swear to God you don't have it?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Nancy Ludwig gave me a sex test during Child Development and I was supposed to do it and pass it to you in independent study. Randy shrugs her shoulders. It's news to her.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (devastated) I'm totally screwed.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Did you put your name on it?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No, but it's really embarrassing. I had to name who I'd do it with if I ever did it. Randy can't wait to hear who Sam's dream lover is.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Who'd you name?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (hesitant) Jake Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Jake Ryan?! He doesn't even know you exist.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (hurt) That's a real nice thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Sorry. But Jake Ryan? He's a senior and he's taken. I mean really taken.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (agrees) I know. It was supposed to be my ideal.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: He's ideal for sure but forget it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: God, I hope whoever got the note doesn't know it was me that wrote it. I'd shit twice and die. They continue down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's loud and crowded. Jake's sitting on a window ledge. He takes Sam's note out of his pocket and reads it. obviously very interested. He turns the page.

dialogues.speaker: TEST
dialogues.text: Jake reads his name in Sam's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits bolt upright. He looks left, then right, to make sure no one's seen the note or suspects him of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Sam move their trays along the line. Sam's looking at her tray with revulsion.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm actually going to consume a school hamburger.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: They're not too terrible since they started using meat. What happened to your carrots?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Brenda was too busy today. If she can't remember my birthday, I can't expect her to remember my carrots.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Are they working?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED / 39
dialogues.text: tests his buddy's reaction to his developing feelings for Sam. The note and its intimate revelations have set off a fury of emotions in Jake and it's almost as though he's seeking approval for the way he feels. Rock is decidedly unromantic. Girls are sex, sex is sport, sport is life. One at a time, the boys rise up into frame, deliver their lines and drop. Until noted, only one boy is on screen at a time.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (cautiously) Do you know Samantha Baker?

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: Sophomore, right?

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: There's nothing there, man. It's not ugly. It's just...void, you know. Jake holds himself up and rests his chin on the bar. Rock pulls himself and holds alongside Jake.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: There's something about her. I do Independant Study with her and I catch her looking at me a lot. It's kind of cool the way she's always looking at me.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I'm being serious, okay? She looks at me like she's in love with me.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED

dialogues.speaker: ROCK

dialogues.speaker: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: ROCK

dialogues.text: You talk like you're hard-up. You got Caroline. She's a woman.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I think about Caroline, you know, and I realize that I never think about her unless I'm with her and then all I'm thinking is how I never think about her. I look in her eyes and I see tits. I look at this other girl and I don't care about tits.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: She doesn't have any.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Don't you understand what I'm saying?

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: I don't think you understand what you're saying. I mean, you can park your pecker wherever you want but I think you're nuts to eighty-six Caroline for some’ sophomore wimp ’ that looks at you weird.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I'm all fucked-up about this, Rock. (sighs) What's happening to me?

dialogues.speaker: ROCK ,
dialogues.text: (worried) I don't know but I hope you're not turning gay. Jake grimaces. He lets go of the bar and walks away. We widen to reveal that the boys have been doing cheater's chin-ups on a five foot bar. Rock's puzzled and disturbed . by Jake's conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls are showering and dressing after gym. We see Sam an Randy standing in the doorway of the shower room with the arms folded across their chests to conceal their modest charms. Sam's shaking her head as she studies the mature physiques of the senior girls. Randy clucks her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: That's unbelievable. I swear to God, Caroline Mulford had to flunk about nine grades.

dialogues.speaker: SAM AND RANDY

dialogues.speaker: RANDY

dialogues.text: is showering in front of them. She looks about twenty-thr with a fully and perfectly developed body. Pin-up time. Her face is in the water spray and she doesn't realize sh being scrutinized. 39 40

dialogues.speaker: RANDY

dialogues.text: Freshmen boys are climbing on board. They're silly and rowdy, pushing and shoving. Sam and Randy move in the crowd of boys, all of them a good head shorter.

dialogues.text: (phoney) Aunt Grace, Rudy and I are just going to adore and enjoy the wok. Rudy's a freak for stir-fry stuff. It was a really neat thought. All of you, really. She sets the wok down along with ten other gift woks. She's received one from every luncheon guest.  49g 50

dialogues.text: All the pool furniture is in the pool along with a bunch rude, wild kids, clothed, semiclothed and nude. They're beating the water as one of them stands on the side, pouring liquid dish detergent in the water to make a huge bubble bath of the pool. Caroline stumbles in.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Jake! (sees the bubbles) Outrageous! I love bubble baths!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drunk Girl in panties and bra is talking to a drunk guy

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Okay, Okay...is this what you want? She unfastens her bra and flashes the guy. He nods yes. She closes the bra.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: That's not what you want.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 113
dialogues.text: Caroline wanders past yelling for Jake.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Jake! Goddamnit! A bedroom door opens and Tracy and Robin come out wearing Jake's mother's furs. They grab Caroline.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: These coats are so excellent! Can we have ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I'll be your best friend forever, even when I'm dead.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I think Jake's mom might freak out if you ripped off her coats.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: She won't mind, I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Cross my heart.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Okay. But you gotta tell me where Jake is. Tracy and Robin points feebly down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Tell me truthfully. Is he with somebody?

dialogues.speaker: SAMANTHA'S YEARBOOK PICTURE 114
dialogues.text: A typical sweet-smile pose. A boy's finger traces down th page to her name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In contrast to his guests, Jake's sober. He closes the yearbook and tosses it on his bed. He picks up the phone and dials information.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (to the phone) Can I have the number of a Samantha Baker in Northfield? If she doesn't have a phone number can you give me all the Bakers or do I have to call back? It's im... : (repeats after the operator) 555-1740. Thanks. He hangs up and writes the number down. He picks up the phone and dials. He unconsciously fixes his hair. He clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's phone rings in the darkened bedroom. It rings and rings. Finally Dorothy stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's growing impatient.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Damn! Come on, answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy feels around for the phone. It rings a couple mor times before she picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives up.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Aw, fuck me! He slams the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorothy sits up in bed with the phone to her ear, staring quizzically. Howard sits up.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Who is it? Dorothy's too shocked to answer.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: What did they want?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: (looks at Howard) Sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the phone back and curses. ” JAKE Shit! There's a knock on his door.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Jake? Are you hiding? He reaches out and unlocks the door. Caroline falls into the room. She lays on her back, laughing. Jake is unamused.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I fell!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It's that funny, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: How come the door was locked?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You're shitfaced!

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Nooo! She cracks herself up again. Jake stands.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Did you make sure nobody else got in the house?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 121
dialogues.text: Caroline sits up on her elbows and nods.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Good. Is the house demolished? Caroline looks at him for a moment, fighting off a smile. Finally she snorts and lets out a horse laugh. Jake jumps up and tears out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: He's grounded for the next twenty- five thousand years. She collapses with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Oldsmobile races up, locks brakes and skids into the The passenger door opens and Sam gets out. The Olds squea away. Sam watches it disappear into the night.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: The Donger's in town five hours and he's got somebody. I live here all my life and I'm like a disease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam reaches into the mailbox for the house key. As she opens the door it occurs to her, that the family may be planning to surprise her. She opens the door quietly and slips in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam closes the door softly. She's smiling, thinking she has it all figured out. She takes off her jacket and tiptoes into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks around the dark room. She turns on a light and braces herself for the big surprise. Nothing. Sitting on the couch is a neat stack of bedding -- sheets, blanke and pillow. Another unconscious, unintentional jab at Sam lonely heart. Everyone in the house is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (sadly) This is just excellent. She walks to the couch and knocks over the pile of beddin She grabs a sheet and throws it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stands in the midst of the riot going on in his pare house. He's resigned to it and the consequences he knows he'll have to face. Caroline comes up into frame, crawlin up his body as he stands stiff and tall. She snakes her arms around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: You're the only one at the party who isn't having a party. Don't you like to party anymore? He looks at her passively. He plants his hand squarely on her face and gives her a gentle shove. She keels over and crashes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 127
dialogues.text: EXT. JAKE'S HOUSE’ 128 The Oldsmobile roars up the driveway with a flat tire. It rams straight into a parked car. Dong and the Lumberjack climb out. The drive-in tray is still attached to the car window. A beat and the back door opens and the biker and his old lady get out and saunter up to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dialing Sam's number again. He waits as it rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline crawls up the hall.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Jake? Sweetie pie? I love you. Where are you, Jake? She stops at his door and looks in.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Jakey? Have you stopped loving me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He angrily kicks his door shut.  132 133 and 134 135 136

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE 132
dialogues.text: Caroline's nose is half an inch from the closed door. She sighs and turns to crawl back to the party. She discovers that her hair's stuck in the door. She tugs. No good. She knocks.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Get outta here!

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I can't, honey, sweetie, asshole. Robin and Tracy stagger up the hall, still wearing the co

dialogues.text: Trace? Can you help me?

dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Several things. 133 OMITTED and 134

dialogues.text: Dorothy and Howard sit up again. Howard grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's shocked at the angry greeting. He looks at the numbe he's written down. We can hear Howard yelling over the phone.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Who is this?! I know you're there! I_can hear you breathing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake swallows hard, summons his courage and speaks to Howard.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Yes. Hello, sir. I wonder if you could be so kind as to tell me if I am indeed reaching the party I wish to reach.

dialogues.speaker: 136-B
dialogues.text: 137 thru 144

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Are you the little bugger who's been calling here and hanging up?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: That must have been some other little bugger, sir. I've been at church. Would this possibly be the home of a Miss Samantha Baker? And if so, sir, may I converse with her briefly?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Yes it is and no you may not.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Might I leave a message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard covers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: He wants to leave a message for Sam.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Give me that phone. Howard turns the phone over to Dorothy.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Now you listen to me, mister. God didn't put me on this earth to be awakened with filthy suggestions from a rude-mouth hooligan like you. As for our granddaughter, she has more than enough sense to stay clear of the likes of you. Good night and good-bye! She slams the phone down and looks at Howard.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: It's a good thing Sam has us, Howard.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Even if she doesn't always appreciate us. Dorothy gives Howard a peck on the cheek. He turns off th light. 137 OMITTED thru 144  145 146 thru 149 150

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Geek, Bryce and Cliff are walking up Jake's driveway. Bryce's beeper goes off.

dialogues.speaker: BRYCE
dialogues.text: Shit! That's my mom. I gotta get home.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Change your frequency, okay? Don't be such a wimp. This is a great social opportunity for us.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: We'll get pounded if we go to a senior party.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Hey, we've got seventy bucks and a pair of girl's underwear. We're safe as kittens. Bryce takes off his beeper and fiddles with it.

dialogues.text: The Geek, Bryce and Cliff reach the front door. They're bubbling with excitement at being moments from an out of control senior party.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Don't embarrass me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: BRYCE
dialogues.text: For sure, we won't.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Be polite to his parents. The Geek rings the bell. A beat and it opens. A very drunk and silly Dong looks out.

dialogues.text: Come on in and party hearty dude persons.  151 thru 155

dialogues.text: The biker is sitting on the window seat with his thirty- fifth beer in his paw. He's drunk and sullen. A bombed but still perky girl Megan, is trying to make conversatio She's apparently oblivious to his dangerous look.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: So, what school do you go to? The biker looks at her through half-closed lids.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (fast) If I had to guess I'd say St. Anthony's "cause all the guys there are like totally into the leather and metal thing. The biker holds his incredulous stare and curls an angry lip revealing a horrifying mouthful of decayed teeth.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (fast) I don't mean to be obnoxious but you really should consider an orthodonist. My orthodonist is the best. He's amazingly gorgeous and he doesn't have hairy hands. It is so gross to have disgusting hairy men's hands in your mouth, and.... The biker puts his cigarette out in his mouth, momentaril silencing the girl.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Didn't that hurt? We move off the biker to his old lady sitting next to him She's drinking a bottle of beer. There's a jock sitting next to her. He's checking her out. She looks at him. He raises a seductive eyebrow. She pushes the bottle into he mouth and twists it slowly back and forth in an even more seductive gesture. The jock's eyes light up. He smiles. The biker's old lady leans forward. The jock leans forwar to meet her. The biker's old lady bites the end off the bottle and chews the glass. The jock's face register's total fear. He backs away.  156 157

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light are low, make-out time. Bodies are spread across the furniture and the floor. A soft core porno picture is playing on the big screen TV. A piece of hurle pizza slaps the screen and sticks on the image of a naked female rump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Geek, Cliff and Bryce sit on either side of Rock. All three are bombed. Rock motions to the screen with his hug hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: That's Jake's parents. The Geek, Cliff and Bryce Chinese their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Outrageous!

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: I've seen this thing about ten times. You got a video recorder?

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: You got parents?

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: You get 'em a video recorder and I'll come over.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: (flattered) You'd come over to my house?

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: Got anything good to eat?

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: Okay, after here, we'll go to your place. The Geek's eyes open wide with terror. He tries to slip away. Rock puts his arm around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: You know, under normal circumstances, I'd pull out your eyes and piss on your brain little dude. But since you volunteered your house and your hospitality, I think I'll let you live. (hands him a beer) Anybody offer you a brew? The Geek nervously takes the beer. He's obviously never drunk in his life.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: Tip it. First one's free. The Geek puts the beer to his lips. He closes his eyes an throws the can back. He holds the can back, but doesn't swallow. He groans and slowly lowers the can. As he takes it away from his sickly face we see a soggy cigarette but clenched in his teeth and tobacco sprinkles and ash on hi lips.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: Sap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd has decided on a course of action to free Caroline.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Okay! Everybody shut up! I have to concentrate, okay? She kneels down beside Caroline.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: You promise you won't get mad?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: No. I love you. Her friend produces a pair of kitchen shears.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Close your eyes. Caroline closes her eyes and her friend cuts her free.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I don't know how to thank you enough.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 158
dialogues.text: She hugs her friend and we see the full extent of the damage. One side of her head is long, blonde hair, the other is clipped to the ear. The crowd in the hallway let out a spirited cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's sound asleep. Like an angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda's asleep. There's an empty spot next to her in the bed. Jim's sitting in the window, staring at a family portrait.

dialogues.speaker: PORTRAIT 161
dialogues.text: It's Jim and Brenda, Mike, Sara, Ginny and Sam.

dialogues.speaker: JIM 162
dialogues.text: He smiles at the fond memories the pictures stirs. He lea back against the wall and closes his eyes. A beat and he slowly opens his eyes. He looks at the picture again. He' suddenly very troubled. He looks at the dial of his watch

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus! It's Sam's birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The few cars remaining pull out, leaving a trashed lawn a an even more trashed house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mournful blues number plays as we begin a sad tour of t revaged house in the kitchen where we see that every edib item has been consumed. The cupboards are bare. The refrigerator is open and empty. There are cartons, cans and rubbish everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dining room table is completely covered by a pyramid beer cans. The pyramid collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move around the room to see that a painting that featu a face without eyes or a mouth has had eyes and mouth dra in with a marking pen. An ancient mask in a plexi display case, lit by a pin spot has cigarettes up its nose and a slice of pizza on its forehead. A line of cigarettes have been left to burn out on the piano. A record album is laying inside a pizza box. We move off the box to find a pizza going around on the turntable. We move up to see th tape deck has a cassette jammed into it upside down. A hundred feet of tape is balled-up in the heads. On the ceiling is a big blob of dip with a potato chip stuck in As we reach Jake, he's sitting on the couch in the destro living room. He sighs and pops a beer. He takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What a fuckin' disaster. He sets the beer down on the coffee table. He sits back o the couch. A beat and he bolts forward and gawks the coff table.

dialogues.speaker: HIS POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: is a heavy glass cube. Jake clears aside the rubbish on the table top to reveal the Geek's desperate, exasperated face. He's trapped inside the cube. He's frantic, poundin noiselessly on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake struggles and grunts to overturn the coffee table.. rolls over on one side and the Geek takes a deep breath o fresh air.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (angry) What were you doing in there!? + GEEK . Watching my life pass before my eyes. The Geek pulls himself up and flops down on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Rock the jock put me inside that thing.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: He gave me a choice of that or being handcuffed nude to the shopping cart return rack at the Jewel. I opted for death with dignity. Jake shakes his head in anger.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: He's a fucking asshole.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: I think he could use a little sensi- tivity training. The Geek looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Your house got eighty-sixed. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Third time this year. I'm fucked for good. The Geek nods his agreement.

dialogues.speaker: EE
dialogues.text: I'll help you clean up.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. We've got a housekeeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frail, young Spanish housekeeper is smoking dope in b with Dong and the Lumberjack. :

dialogues.speaker: DONG
dialogues.text: (stoned; drunk) I'm twice as happy as I ever been.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSEKEEPER
dialogues.text: si!

dialogues.speaker: DONG
dialogues.text: Hai!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim creeps quietly down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's asleep. Jim walks into the living room. He stops and looks at Sam on the couch. He smiles as he watches he sleeping. He steps around to the couch and sits down. He hesitates for a moment before he pats her head. He's a ma not accustomed to intimacy and affection.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: (whispers) Sam? Sweetheart? She stirs and looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Hi, kiddo.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Everything's fine. I was just upstairs and I couldn't sleep and .-I feel like a real jerk, honey. We forgot your birthday. Sam is pleased that he remembered. -

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: You gotta be burned up, huh? Sam smiles understandingly.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It's no big thing.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: This family can really foul things up.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'm not all that upset anymore.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: How about a party? Not a family party. You have your friends. We'll stay the hell away. Whatever you want, honey. You let me know. Have it the way you want it. The way you want it. She pulls herself up and kisses his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Thanks, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: No problem. Everything else okay? Sam nods. Jim gives her a wink and a kiss on the forehead

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: See you in the morning. He stands up and starts for the foyer. Sam whimpers’ to h

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No. She starts to cry. Jim turns around.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It's not okay. Jim hurries back to the couch. Sam throws her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don't know. Everything.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Everything what? Sam sits back on the couch and quickly wipes away her tea

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Everything, everything.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Your birthday?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She's a little embarrassed to reveal the real reason she' crying.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: There's this boy.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Oh, Lord. Is this something I should go get Mom for? Sam shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No. I like this boy a real lot. And he doesn't like me.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Are you nice to him?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Daddy, I don't know. It's really stupid. It's not important.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: If you're crying over it, it's important.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I like him so much and I just know I can't ever have him.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Because I'm just a dork.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: He's a senior and he's beautiful and he's got this great girl friend and I'm just blah.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: I don't think you're blah.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Trust me, I am.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Can I tell you a little story?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: About the Navy?

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Jim nods. No, it's a love story.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Are you in it? As bad as Sam feels, she cracks up at the thought of her father in love.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: This was awhile ago, I .combed my hair different, I was young and fit and I didn't walk around the house in my undershorts. I was in college and I was head over heels in love with this girl. Sam giggles.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Don't hurt my feelings.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Anyway, she wouldn't even look at me. So I knew that if anything was going to happen, I'd have to make the first move.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I just can't picture you making a move on a girl.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Either could I. But after worrying about it for a couple of weeks, I finally got up the courage to go to the sorority house where she lived. I let her know I wanted to see her and she came down. I wanted to faint. She walked over to me and....

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I think I know how this ends, Dad. She turned out to be Mom and you guys got married and had us.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) No. She stomped on my foot so hard, she broke two toes. I met your mom at the hospital. There's a pause as both Jim and Sam realize that his stor has no relevance to Sam's situation.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: I guess that doesn't help you much, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well, if it's any consolation, I love you and if this guy can't see in you all the heautiful, wonderful things I see, he's got the problem.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It just hurts.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: That's why they call them crushes. If they were easy, they'd call. them some- thing else.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: If I were Ginny, I'd have this guy crawling on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something about Ginny. IT love her just as much as I love you. But she's a different person. I'ma little worried about her. When things come easy, you don't always appreciate them. You, I'm not worried. When it happens to you, Samantha, it'll be forever. He leans over and kisses her forehead. He draws her close and hugs her. She kisses him and holds him as tight as he holds her.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: I won't be able to sleep unless I know I helped you out with this little talk, so would you be a sport and lie to me? Sam giggles.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, Daddy. Jim gives her a squeeze and a kiss on the forehead. He gets up and crosses to the foyer. He stops and turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: One more thing, sweetheart. (pause) Where in the hell are your under- shorts?

dialogues.speaker: SAM'S PANTIES 170
dialogues.text: A boy's hand carefully examines Sam's panties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Geek is sharing his treasure with Jake. Jake regards the panties with an almost religious reverence.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: These are really hers? The Geek nods proudly.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Did you pants her or something?

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: She gave them to me. Jake looks curiously at the Geek.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: ORGANIST
dialogues.text: I can't find the groom. Ginny lets out a titter.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Cruise the bars. That's where I found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Geek's still sleeping. Caroline gently slaps his face

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: You wanna wake up, please? The Geek stirs and opens his eyes. He looks around in bewilderment until he orients himself. He sits up with a start.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I'll tell you where you are if you tell me who you are. The Geek peels off his headgear.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: I'm Farmer Ted.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: You're in a parking lot. He cranes his neck and looks out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: . CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Got me, junior. He notices that half her hair's missing.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Did I do that?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: At this point, anything's possible. The Geek scratches his head -- a faint memory comes to mi

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Did we...?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Did I...enjoy it? (answers his own questions) What am I? Nuts? Of course I did. I had to. (pause) Did you? Caroline thinks for a troubled moment.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: You know, I have this weird feeling I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda's walking Ginny up and down, trying to get her to drink coffee.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous! Ginny! Ginny looks at Brenda with woeful, sleepy eyes. Sam and Sara watch from a window bench.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: The family has definitely gone into a new orbit.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's kind of scary. I have to live with them another ten years.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Does my dress look wretched? Sara studies it, concentrating on the bust.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: You could use some carrots.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: If I stuff Kleenex down my front, will you tell everybody in the world?

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Just boys. Sam curls her lip. She pushes in on one of her boobs. The cup caves in.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Excellent, huh? Nothing ever goes right for me. I'm cursed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's Porsche is parked out in front. He's at the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake rings the bell. Inside we hear horrible moaning and groaning and animal-like bellowing. Jake peeks in the sid door windows.  220 221

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dong limps in wearing Brenda's pink bathrobe and boxer shorts. He's holding two cold cans of Coke to his temples. He's walking bow-legged. He has a black eye.

dialogues.speaker: DONG
dialogues.text: Mwaaa. Let me die. Mwaaaa. He moves the cans to the groin injury he sustained when Dorothy kicked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dong opens the door. Jake is startled to see him. Dong is even more startled. He screams and slams the door closed.

dialogues.speaker: DONG, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Eek! I call police! F.B.I.! Go_away!

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Open the door!

dialogues.speaker: DONG, (0.C..)
dialogues.text: No_way Jose! You beat up my face! Jake leans down and yells into the mail chtte.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You jumped me and squeezed my nuts! Jake steps back as Dong opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: DONG
dialogues.text: (surprised) That you?! (apologetic) So sorry. I thought it new American girl friend.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (impatient) Forget it, okay? Just get Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: DONG
dialogues.text: She not here.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Don't jerk me around. Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: DONG
dialogues.text: She get married.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: DONG
dialogues.text: She at church. She get married to oily Bohunk. Jake turns from the door, puzzled and bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests are filing in. Mike is an usher. A conservatively dressed couple walks in.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Guests of the bride or the groom?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Bride. Mike points down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: To your left, sir. A wildly dressed couple walks in. Mike looks them up and down and deduces from their clothing that they're guests the groom.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Friends of the groom, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda's straightening Ginny's dress. She has her propped against the wall. Sam and Sara are waiting patiently with their bouquets.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: You're sure you're all right, sweetie? Ginny nods, yes.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: It's gonna be a piece of cake, Bren’.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (sincere and warm) Ginny? I want to tell you something just in case you pass out. I'm really happy for you. I'm sorry if I've been kind of a jerk lately.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: (slurry and high) Hey, screw it, honey. I love you like a sister.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I know you'll have a great marriage. She leans over and kisses Ginny. Ginny smiles and keels over backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim waits nervously for the music cue and the bride. In the adjacent room, we hear a loud thud! The organ comes u with the first bars of "The Wedding March." Jim rushes to the door of the anteroom and opens it. Inside we see Brenda helping a dazed Ginny to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Organist stops playing and listens, along with everyo else, to Jim and Brenda.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: I don't care what she has! Look at her!

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Would you please be quiet?! We don't have to announce to everybody that she has her period!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange embarrassed smiles. Behind them, the organist pokes her head out of the organ chamber window.

dialogues.speaker: GROOM
dialogues.text: I guess the guys who thought we had to get married feel pretty stupid right about now, huh, padre? The Reverend nods politely.  227 228

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda helps Ginny onto Jim's arm. He supports her. Brenda hurries down the aisle, apologizing as she runs. She takes her seat. Sam and Sara pick up Ginny's train. Jim starts down the aisle with Ginny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny flashes stoned smiles as she shuffles down the aisl

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: (whispers) How's it goin'? I hope none of you guys got me woks. Jim squeezes her arm. She shuts up. They pass a woman wit a feathered hat and Ginny can't resist batting the feathe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline and the Geek are chatting amicably. There's a hint of tenderness in the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: You were awfully nice to me. I must have been mucho obnoxioso.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: You bit me.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: It's okay. I guess last night was just about the best night of my life. Now and probably the future, too.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Yeah. What I remember was okay. I never went out with a freshman. Not even when I was a freshman.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: Me either.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: You were pretty crazy.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: I was?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you know what I like best?

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: My clean, close shave?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Waking up in your arms. The Geek is flabbergasted. He looks at his arms.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: These things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's car pulls up in front of the church. A rented limousine is waiting. The Driver is leaning on the fender smoking a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (to the Driver) Is there a wedding going on in there?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: That's the rumor.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You wouldn't know if the bride is like a sophomore in high school would you? The Driver looks at him like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: This ain't Kentucky.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (sighs with relief) True. I'm sort of like possibly falling in love with this girl perhaps and it'd be the shits if she got married before I got a chance to take her out, you know? So...thanks. He revs his engine and whips around into the parking lot.  231 232 233

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pulls up alongside the Rolls. He stands up and looks out his sunroof into the Rolls.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline and the Geek are locked in a passionate kiss. Through half-closed eyes, Caroline sees Jake.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: (voice distorted by the kiss) Uh oh. She pulls away from the Geek, leaving him Frenching the air. She smiles at Jake.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: (timid) Hi, Jake. The Geek hears Jake's name.. His eyes open in fear. Caroline straightens her blouse and pushes her hair back.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: (nervous, to Jake) Do you have a minute? She stands up and swings her legs over the side of the Ro

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: (to the Geek) Don't go away. The car phone rings. Geek answers it. He's annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: GEEK
dialogues.text: You wanna learn what happened? Buy the book. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline gets in the passenger side. She's nervous and unsure of how's she's going to explain herself. He's just as nervous. They both sit for a moment, exchanging timid, embarrassed glances.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Sorry about getting you involved with that guy.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: It's okay. Really. (nervous chuckle) It wasn't too terrible. (embarrassed) Weird? She's embarrassed to admit to her feelings for the Geek. Jake smiles. Regardless of how little he's been feeling for Caroline, it still hurts him that she was with somebo else. It' Jake nods Jake nods. s a knee-jerk reaction.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (recovers his pride) So, what should we do?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: About us? uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: It's gonna be two years for us like next Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (corrects her) Wednesday.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Is it? There's an uncomfortable pause. For the first time, Caroline looks innocent and vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Neither one of us is going to die if it doesn't happen for us.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: True.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I just don't know right now. But I'm covered, okay? I won't get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jake is seriously straddling the fence between Sam and Caroline. He hadn't anticipated this conversation or Caroline's changed attitude. He doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I'll leave it up to you. Jake looks over at Caroline. It's his decision. The situation is of his making and he accepts that it's also his to resolve. He nods his agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight streams in the windows, the stained glass glows. It's peaceful and serene as the ceremony is underway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears well up in her eyes as she watches her big sister take the vows. She looks like an angel and even the yello dress she hated so much looks lovely on her. There's a storm of emotion going on inside her. She's happy, jealous, sad, lonely, angry, hurt. She sniffles and tries not to cry. Something distracts her. She looks down at her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caved-in cup slowly pops out. -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grandmothers are crying. Howard sniffles. Fred blows his nose with a loud honk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's eyes are wandering across the ceiling. Sara's picking her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch with pride. Brenda's crying. Jim lifts his glasses and dries his eyes.  239 240 241 242 243 244

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy and Ginny exchange their vows. The Reverend speaks i hushed and pensive tones.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Do you, Virginia, take this.... Ginny interrupts him ina casual, slurry voice.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: You bet, bub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange troubled glances. Brenda looks past Jim to Rudy's parents and apologizes with a weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their mouths are open in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny peels off her veil and tosses it onto a floral arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Sorry, I can't see with that ridiculous thing in my face. Go ahead. I'm cool now. The Reverend clears his throat, overlooks Ginny's stoned ‘interruption and continues.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: ...take this man to be your lawful wedded husband?

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: (looking at Rudy) Oh, for sure. He's hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winces at the mess Ginny's making of her wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara rolls her eyes. Mike shakes his head and covers his face with his hands.  245 c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He repeats the vow for Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Do you, Rudolf take this woman to be your lawful wedded wife?

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: (to Rudy) Your turn, babe.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: (ignores her) I do.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: With these rings.... Rudy's best man hands him Ginny's ring. Sam hands Ginny Rudy's ring.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Sam. (looks at her dress, whispers) You know that dress doesn't look nearly as shitty on you as it did at the store. Sam turns Ginny around to face Rudy. Ginny drops the ring

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Oh, crap! She gets down on all fours and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four lean forward at the same time, hardly believing what they're seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reverend races through the rest of the ceremony to ge it over with before anything else happens.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: ...I thee wed. Ginny and Rudy exchange rings.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: You may now kiss the bride. Rudy puts his arms on Ginny's waist. He leans forward and puckers. Ginny keels over backwards, leaving Rudy kissing air. Organ music surges in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both families stream out of the church and gather around the door. The photographer sets himself up at the bottom of the stairs. Ginny and Rudy come out and everybody tosses rice. Ginny tries to catch some in her mouth. Rudy quickly hustles her to the waiting limousine. The crowd begins to head toward the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She remembers that Ginny's left her veil inside.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: She forgot her veil! She turns and goes back into the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads back up the aisle for the altar. She wipes her tears away as she walks. She reaches the altar and retrie the veil from the floral arrangement. She straightens it and very carefully and reverently folds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four of them head across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Didn't Ginny look lovely?

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: And so relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Let's hope she stays awake long enough to consummate this thing.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Fred!

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Who're we riding with? Jim and Brenda approach with Mike and Sara trailing behind. Jim and Brenda are bickering.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: (to Brenda) Let's just get the hell over to the reception! .

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Hold your horses!

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: I don't want her sitting in the cake....

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: She's not going to sit in the cake! Reverend Allen didn't drive so I'll take him and the organist and the kids. You take the old people.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Now she's calling us old! Brenda hurries away. Jim ushers the old folks to the stre

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Let's put a fire under it! The photographer comes up and tries to pose Jim and the old people.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Will you knock it off! He groans and joins the old folks in a group pose. They all smile. Flash!

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Okay, let's move it out! Jim and the old folks cross the street between the traffi jam of horn honking cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam comes out of the church to find that her thoughfulnes in retrieving Ginny's veil has been rewarded by her being left behind. The crowning blow. She stands alone on the church steps in her stupid dress with her stupid flowers, tears on her face. She looks down at the ground. The loneliest girl in all of creation. She looks up and wipes her tears on her arm. She drops her head again.  253 254 255 256 257 258

dialogues.speaker: SAM 253
dialogues.text: Her head is bowed. She looks up slowly through her hair. She pauses with her head raised halfway. She can't believ her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HER POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: have all pulled away and parked on the street directly ac from the church is Jake's Porsche. Jake is standing next the car, looking across at Sam. He's smiling nervously. H raises his hand, offers a tiny, tentative wave.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: SAM 255
dialogues.text: For a moment, she doesn't think he's talking to her. She glances over her shoulder to make sure he's looking at he and not someone behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His smile fades. He interprets her hesitation in returnin his greeting as rejection. He feels like a fool.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Shit. She hates me. I knew it. He carefully reaches around behind and opens the door. Th he quickly jumps in and starts the engine. He pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: SAM 257
dialogues.text: Her eyes open wide in horror. She screams.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Jake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake slams on the brakes. He sees Sam running. He throws the car in reverse and backs up to the church. He jumps out. Sam waits for a car to pass, then runs to him.  259 260

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know what to say. He doesn't know what to say. It's the moment they've both been waiting for and neither one knows what to do.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I heard that you were here.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You came for me?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Is that okay?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Actually, it's excellent.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Do you have to go to a reception or something?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Can I call you later?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake gets back in the car. He puts it in gear and starts to pull away.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I mean, no! Jake stops.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No, I can't call?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I mean no, I'm not going to the reception. Jake grins from ear to ear.  261 262 263 264 265 266

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is helping the old people into the car. Something catches his eye. He watches curiously.

dialogues.speaker: HIS POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: opens his car door for Sam. sam sees Jim. She points to Jake as he walks around to the driver's side to let Jim know that Jake is the love of her life.

dialogues.speaker: JIM 263
dialogues.text: a smile spreads across his face as he realizes that Jake the boy Sam was talking about the night before. He winks and gives Sam the thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Will you hurry up, Jim! We're.... Without taking his eyes off Sam, Jim slams the car door, cutting off Dorothy.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY 264
dialogues.text: through the backseat window, we see that Jim has closed t door on her hat.

dialogues.speaker: SAM 265
dialogues.text: She throws Jim a big kiss and gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda, Jim, Mike and Sara are under the portico. Brenda' worried, Jim is smug and coy. He knows where Sam is. He plays along with the others.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: What could have happened to Sam?

dialogues.speaker: . JIM
dialogues.text: I'm sure she's fine.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Maybe she blew this thing off. It's possible she's not as dumb as she looks.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: She'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: I know she's still upset about her birthday.

dialogues.speaker: . MIKE
dialogues.text: We dumped on her royally, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: . SARA
dialogues.text: I feel terrible and it's not even me that it happened to.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: We'll make it up to her.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Poor thing.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (wipes his nose on his sleeve) Yeah. Pathetic underdog wench.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Jim, will you call home? I can't stand the thought of her sitting by herself alone in a dark house. The family heads back into the club. Jim hangs back smili knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark except for a fragile glow of yellow in t center of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: BIRTHDAY CAKE . 268
dialogues.text: A birthday cake with sixteen lit candles rests on a styrofoam ring floating in the pool. Sam and Jake are in the water on either side of the ring, looking across the candles at each other. They slowly circle the cake, looking long and deep into each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Thanks for getting my undies back.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming over.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming to get me.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Samantha. He leans across the cake and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Make a wish. Sam smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It already came true. Sam looks down at the cake, takes a deep breath and blows out the candles. Music up. "Sixteen Candles." Big, loud and bright as we begin:
